cards.title: Tour de France 2015 / Stage eight highlights

item.title: Tour de France 2015: stage eight highlights
item.trailText: Alexis Vuillermoz of France stunned the favourites by sprinting to victory at the summit of Mûr de Bretagne to claim stage eight
item.standFirst: Alexis Vuillermoz of France stunned the favourites by sprinting to victory at the summit of Mûr de Bretagne to claim stage eight. Slovakia's Peter Sagan crossed the line in fourth, which was enough to earn him the green jersey of the German André Greipel, while Britain's Chris Froome stays in yellow ahead of the team time trial

cards.title: Hereford FC's historic first game at Edgar Street – in pictures
cards.rawTitle: Hereford FC's historic first game at Edgar Street

item.title: Hereford FC's historic first game at Edgar Street
item.trailText: The new Hereford Football Club was born with a friendly against FC United of Manchester. Photographer Andy Hall went along to illustrate the historic match
item.standFirst: The new Hereford Football Club, founded by supporters after their beloved, historic Hereford United crumpled into liquidation last year, has been reborn and took on FC United of Manchester in a friendly, their first at Edgar Street. Observer photographer Andy Hall joined the 4000+ crowd at the historic match

cards.title: David Beckham effortlessly catches tennis ball at Wimbledon
cards.rawTitle: David Beckham effortlessly catches tennis ball at Wimbledon

item.title: David Beckham effortlessly catches tennis ball at Wimbledon
item.trailText: Former England captain David Beckham wows Wimbledon's crowd after catching a tennis ball with one hand
item.standFirst:
Former England captain David Beckham wows Wimbledon's crowd after catching a tennis ball with one hand. Beckham catches the ball as it flew into the royal box during Jamie Murray and John Peers' doubles semi-final against Jonathan Erlich and Philipp Petzschner on Thursday. Murray and Peers won the match 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 6-2 and are now in the final

Courtesy: BBC

cards.title: Tennis / McEnroe surprises fans with a drive to Wimbledon
cards.rawTitle: McEnroe surprises fans with a drive to Wimbledon

item.title: John McEnroe surprises fans with a drive to Wimbledon
item.trailText: Two fans on the way to Wimbledon are in for a surprise when their chauffeur is replaced with tennis legend John McEnroe
item.standFirst: Two fans on the way to Wimbledon get a surprise when their chauffeur is replaced with tennis legend John McEnroe. McEnroe also shares his thoughts on Andy Murray, who is now in the semi-finals, and defending champion Novak Djokovic. The Wimbledon commentator says he believes the Serb is more vulnerable on grass, but insists both players have been playing solidly

cards.title: Ashes 2015 / 'Clarke just smashed it straight back at me,' says Moeen
cards.rawTitle: 'Clarke just smashed it straight back at me,' says Moeen

item.title: Ashes 2015: 'Clarke just smashed it straight back at me,' says England’s Moeen Ali
item.trailText: England's Moeen Ali talks through his key wickets of Michael Clarke and Steve Smith on day two of the first Test. England were all out for 430 with Australia finishing the day at 5 for 264
item.standFirst:
England's Moeen Ali talks through his key wickets of Michael Clarke and Steve Smith on day two of the first Test. England were all out for 430 with Australia finishing the day at 5 for 264. 'He kept coming at me', Ali said of his wicket to take Australia's Steve Smith, ranked the number one batsman in the world

Video courtesy of the ECB

cards.title: Cycling / Tour de France 2015: stage five

item.title: Tour de France 2015: stage five
item.trailText: The best photos from stage five, a 189.5km ride between Arras and Amiens.
item.standFirst: The best photos from stage five, a 189.5km ride between Arras and Amiens. A close sprint finish saw André Greipel cross the line in first place while Tony Martin was shepherded safely home to ensure that the Etixx-Quick Step rider retained the yellow jersey

displayImages.caption: Team Sky riders Chris Froome, fourth left, and Peter Kennaugh, second left, pay their respects after laying a wreath at the Memorial of Commonwealth in Arras.  Photograph: Sebastien Nogier/EPA
displayImages.altText: Team Sky riders Christopher Froome, fourth left, and Peter Kennaugh, second left, pay their respects after laying a wreath at the Memorial of Commonwealth in the memory of the WWI fallen ahead of the stage start
displayImages.cleanCaption: Team Sky riders Chris Froome, fourth left, and Peter Kennaugh, second left, pay their respects after laying a wreath at the Memorial of Commonwealth in Arras.

cards.title: Football / Tottenham Hotspur to host NFL games at new stadium
cards.rawTitle: Tottenham Hotspur to host NFL games at new stadium

item.title: Tottenham Hotspur to host NFL games at new stadium
item.trailText: Tottenham Hotspur announce on Wednesday that they have agreed to a 10-year deal with the NFL to stage at least two games a year
item.standFirst: Tottenham Hotspur announce on Wednesday that they have agreed to a 10-year deal with the NFL to stage at least two games a year. The new stadium, which will hold 61,000 spectators, will have an artificial surface for NFL games installed under the regular grass pitch which will be used by Spurs
